snippet: His attempt to bring down Italy’s coalition government was one Machiavellian maneuver too many for his followers.
abstract: Editorial notes that Silvio Berlusconi's decades-long spell over Italian politics seems to have finally broken, after his attempt to bring down Prime Min Enrico Letta's coalition government failed; contends that decision by those in Berlusconi's party to put the country's stability ahead of his machinations offers a chance to start building a serious program for economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: His attempt to bring down Italy’s coalition government was one Machiavellian maneuver too many for his followers.
